div.p: This page is intended for advanced users, those who maintain applications which embed or extend NetLogo, or those who maintain large numbers of models and want to be more familiar with the format they are saved in. For most users, the saving, loading, and editing features NetLogo provides will be more than sufficient to serve their needs.

The schema for the nlogox format is built using W3C XML Schema (sometimes referred to as xsd), a standard format for describing xml-based data representations. nlogox files are also valid XML files and may be operated on using XML tools such as XSLT and XPath. The NetLogo model schema is included with the HTML version of this manual here. To view the schema, save the linked page and open in a text editor.

There are several major areas that this guide covers. Many users are only interested in a single type or section of the format; we recommend using the Table of Contents (below) to learn more about your area of interest. This page is divided into several topics. The first of these is File Sections which describes the elements which live directly inside the <model> tag. The second major area, Composite Types covers the attributes and sub-elements of various xml elements used in the file. Most of the sections define their content in terms of these types and provide links where appropriate. The final major areas are Atomic Types which gives information about the syntax and meaning of various format and attribute content, and Enumerations which provides a list of special values used in various places in the file format.
